definition: many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"

sentences.english: April and Corinnehad been gone from home for some time, so I had no way of knowing what they looked like.
sentences.chinese: 阿普里尔和科琳已离家多时，我无缘一睹她们的芳容。

sentences.english: When Bodhisattva Avalokiteshvara was practicing the profound Prajna Paramita, he illuminated the Five Skandhas and saw that they are all empty.
sentences.chinese: 观自在菩萨行甚深般若波罗蜜多时，照见五蕴皆空。

sentences.english: Speech appeared in the little girl's second year.
sentences.chinese: 这小女孩在一岁多时开始说话。

sentences.english: Some might be surprised to hear that the Mavs haven't gotten to the rim as much as they did last season.
sentences.chinese: 有人在听到小牛突破篮下没有上赛季多时可能会惊讶。

sentences.english: Whevern I heared the news that someone of these friends was gone, I would be sad for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 我每当听到一个旧友死去的消息时候，总要惆怅多时。

sentences.english: I was expecting you. Are you NYPD or FBI?
sentences.chinese: 恭候多时了。你们是纽约警局的还是联邦调查局的？

sentences.english: Was coursing in the deep Prajna Paramita.
No news for a long time, and finally to an interview with Professor Kong Wei.
sentences.chinese: 记者辗转多时，终于采访到了孔维教授。

sentences.english: Obviously the place hadn't seen much use lately.
sentences.chinese: 很显然，这房间已经弃置不用多时了。

sentences.english: This project has been a long time in the making and now we cannot wait to set sail .
sentences.chinese: 这个计画已筹划多时，现在我们等不及要启程出海了。

sentences.english: She could reckon from 1 to 100 when she was more than one year old.
sentences.chinese: 她一岁多时就能从一数到一百。

sentences.english: It was a little after seven when he stopped and settled back into his rocking chair.
sentences.chinese: 七点多时，他停了下来，坐回了摇椅。

sentences.english: It is said that "cat hath nine lives", yet care would wear them all out.
sentences.chinese: 据说猫儿有九命，忧虑多时也伤身。

definition: to look forward to sth/to wait respectfully
to wait for/to expect/to keep watch/to watch over/to nurse
time/auspicious time/time and date/long period of time/this day
to be unable to hold back
